decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to quickly play Arclight Phoenix and utilize a combination of spells like Lightning Axe, Fiery Impulse, and Treasure Cruise to deal damage efficiently and bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard. The deck also includes card draw and cantrips to maintain card advantage and consistency. Picklock Prankster and other low-cost spells help to trigger the Arclight Phoenix ability multiple times in a turn, overwhelming the opponent with aggressive plays and powerful creatures. The deck aims to win quickly and decisively through a combination of direct damage and creature pressure.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly cast spells, fill up the graveyard with instant and sorcery cards, and bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard to deal damage and pressure the opponent. The deck includes a variety of low-cost spells for card draw and removal, along with ways to pump out extra damage with the Phoenix. The key strategy is to efficiently cycle through the deck, play spells to trigger the Phoenix's ability, and overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of spells and attacks.

The main focus of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to disrupt your opponent's hand and game plan with cards like Duress and Thoughtseize, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Bloodtithe Harvester and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse. The deck also includes removal spells like Go for the Throat and Fatal Push to deal with opposing threats. Additionally, the deck can generate card advantage through Fear of Missing Out and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker. Overall, the strategy is to combine disruption, aggression, and card advantage to outpace and overwhelm the opponent.

This deck focuses on quick and aggressive plays, utilizing red creatures and burn spells to deal damage to the opponent as fast as possible. With a combination of efficient creatures like Manifold Mouse and Screaming Nemesis, along with burn spells like Lightning Strike and Burst Lightning, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. Cards like Kumano Faces Kakkazan and Hazoret the Fervent provide additional reach and damage potential, while cards like Shadowspear can help push through blockers. The deck aims to win the game quickly by applying constant pressure and burning out the opponent.

This deck focuses on assembling the Greasefang, Parhelion combo as quickly as possible using cards like Fleeting Spirit, Guardian of New Benalia, and Monument to Endurance to protect and support the combo pieces. The deck also includes disruption cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to control the board and ensure the combo can be assembled safely. The lands in the deck are chosen to help facilitate the color requirements of the cards and provide a strong mana base for consistency. Overall, the key concept of the deck is to efficiently set up and execute the Greasefang, Parhelion combo to secure victory.

The key strategy of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using Lotus Field and other lands, while controlling the opponent's plays with cards like Archdruid's Charm and Strict Proctor. The deck also utilizes combo pieces such as Hidden Strings and Vizier of Tumbling Sands to generate extra mana and card advantage. By casting powerful spells like Emergent Ultimatum and Omniscience, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and win the game in a flashy and explosive manner. The inclusion of cards like Dark Petition and Bala Ged Recovery adds consistency and resilience to the strategy.

The main focus of this Mono Black Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy through hand disruption, removal spells, and powerful creatures like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse. The deck aims to maintain control over the game while putting pressure on the opponent's life total. Cards like Thoughtseize and Liliana of the Veil help control the opponent's hand size and options, while cards like Fatal Push and Graveyard Trespasser deal with threats on the board. The deck also has some synergies with cards like Unholy Annex and Mutavault to provide additional value and utility.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by using counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It includes a companion creature that supports the control strategy. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's plans while establishing control on the battlefield. It also includes cards that provide card draw and search options to help maintain card advantage. The deck utilizes a mix of lands to support its control strategy and includes powerful planeswalker cards to further enhance its control capabilities.

This Selesnya Aggro deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with efficient creatures like Bishop of Wings, Llanowar Elves, and Skyclave Apparition. The goal is to swarm the opponent with creatures while gaining life through cards like Righteous Valkyrie and Resplendent Angel. Collected Company and Kayla's Reconstruction provide additional creature support, while Hushwood Verge and Brushland ensure consistent mana production. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creature plays and strategic combat maneuvers to secure a swift victory.

This deck focuses on quickly casting spells and using cards like Consider and Sleight of Hand to draw into Arclight Phoenix. Fiery Impulse and Lightning Axe help control the board while Treasure Cruise provides card advantage. The deck also includes Hall of Storm Giants and Otawara, Soaring City for additional value. The goal is to continuously cast spells, bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard, and chip away at the opponent's life total with direct damage spells like Cori-Steel Cutter. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays and card advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using low cost creatures and burn spells. With a focus on fast-paced gameplay and direct damage, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to set up their own strategy. By maximizing efficiency and utilizing cards like Burst Lightning, Manifold Mouse, and Emberheart Challenger, the deck can apply pressure and finish off the opponent swiftly. Additionally, cards like Hazoret the Fervent provide a powerful finisher for the deck, ensuring a strong late-game presence.

The deck focuses on utilizing control elements to manage the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. It includes removal, enchantments for slowing down the opponent, as well as card advantage and lifegain. The deck also features a companion strategy with Yorion, Sky Nomad for additional value. The mana base allows for flexibility and consistency in casting spells. Overall, the strategy revolves around controlling the game tempo, outlasting opponents with incremental advantages, and ultimately overwhelming them with powerful finishers like Elspeth, Storm Slayer.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures like Manifold Mouse, Emberheart Challenger, and Kumano Faces Kakkazan. The deck also focuses on dealing direct damage to the opponent with cards like Burst Lightning, Lightning Strike, and Reckless Rage. Supporting cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Sunspine Lynx provide additional damage output. The inclusion of land cards like Mutavault and Ramunap Ruins helps to ensure consistent mana production. Overall, this deck aims to outpace the opponent and win the game quickly through a combination of creature aggression and direct damage.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy through hand disruption and creature removal while taking advantage of powerful control elements. It relies on cards like Thoughtseize, Fatal Push, and Liliana of the Veil to control the board and limit the opponent's options. Additionally, it uses creatures like Gifted Aetherborn and Graveyard Trespasser to apply pressure and maintain a board presence. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Cecil, Dark Knight to help secure the win once the opponent's resources have been depleted.

The main focus of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to quickly flood the board with low-cost creatures like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves, while also utilizing powerful angel creatures such as Bishop of Wings and Resplendent Angel. By generating tokens and gaining life through cards like Giada, Font of Hope and Righteous Valkyrie, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its aggressive strategy, while also having the ability to generate card advantage through spells like Collected Company. Additionally, the deck includes land cards like Temple Garden and Brushland to ensure mana consistency and flexibility.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells. By utilizing low-cost creatures like Novice Inspector and Knight-Errant of Eos, as well as powerful finishers like Venerated Loxodon and Voldaren Epicure, the deck aims to establish a quick board presence and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Gleeful Demolition and Warden of the Inner Sky provides additional removal and card advantage, giving the deck multiple avenues to secure victory.
